name: sprite.setFrame()
content:
Use the frame number to set the frame for the animation for a sprite.

Use the Animation tab to load multiple images which make up the frames for a labeled animation for your sprite. By default all frames are displayed one after another in round robin fashion. The speed is set by the slider in the Animation tab. Use `play()` to restart the animation. Use `pause()` to stop the animation.

examples.name: Happy, Surprised, Sad
examples.description: Use the mouse to move the smiley face. High in the display for happy, middle of the display for surprised, low in the display for sad.

palette_params.name: frame
palette_params.description: The frame number of the animation you want the sprite to use. The first frame is frame 0.

return_value: No return value. Changes output in the display after drawSprites() is called.
short_description: Use the frame number to set the frame for the animation for a sprite.
tips:
- Sprites all have the same functions and you use the dot notation (combining the name of the sprite, followed by a dot, with the function name) to call the function for that sprite.
- Any changes to the properties of a sprite will not be seen until after `drawSprites()` is called.
